message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We examine the relationship between agricultural production and food security using a panel dataset from 20 African countries.", "dataset": ["panel dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "In this research, we use two datasets: one containing economic data on all firms in France, and another containing geographic information on their locations and the location of various industries.", "dataset": ["economic data on all firms in France", "geographic information on their locations and the location of various industries"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "Using a multi-year dataset on national debt levels and growth rates, we analyze how key economic indicators influence a country's long-term fiscal sustainability.", "dataset": ["multi-year dataset on national debt levels and growth rates"], "topic": ["Debt", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We integrate household survey data with satellite imagery to estimate poverty levels in rural areas of sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on a dataset of mobile phone usage patterns and network coverage to analyze the impact of expanding mobile networks on entrepreneurship in rural areas of India.", "dataset": ["dataset of mobile phone usage patterns", "network coverage"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses longitudinal data on educational attainment and income levels to investigate the causal relationship between education and economic mobility.", "dataset": ["longitudinal data on educational attainment and income levels"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We compare the environmental impact of different transport modes using data from the National Travel Survey and other complementary datasets on carbon emissions and air pollution.", "dataset": ["National Travel Survey", "other complementary datasets on carbon emissions and air pollution"], "topic": ["Transport", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the impact of infrastructure development projects on disaster resilience in vulnerable communities using a dataset of project outcomes and a complementary dataset of social vulnerability indicators.", "dataset": ["dataset of project outcomes", "complementary dataset of social vulnerability indicators"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses data on job vacancies and applications, as well as demographic information on job seekers, to investigate patterns of discrimination in labor markets.", "dataset": ["data on job vacancies and applications", "demographic information on job seekers"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between financial inclusion and household welfare in low-income countries using data from the World Bank's Global Findex and a complementary dataset of households' access to basic services.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Global Findex", "complementary dataset of households' access to basic services"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
